Posts.Content: Dixiemine30 wrote: This was given to me in a packet of information from the Baptist Breast Center and written by Judy Kneece, RN, OCN.  I love it and have decided that I'm going to pray it (and mean it) every day!! Lord, I have just received the diagnosis of breast cancer, Still my anxious heart as I seek to understand why. Teach me to transform this suffering into growth, My great fear of tomorrow into faith in your presence, My tears into understanding, My discouragement into courage, My anger into forgiveness, My bitterness into acceptance, My experience with cancer into my testimony, My crisis into a platform on which I can learn to help others. God, grant that one day I can embrace this time as my friend, and not as my enemy. BMX 02/02/2012 w/TEs, Exchange to Saline Implants 5/21/2012 Dx 1/3/2012, DCIS, <1cm, Stage 0, Grade 3, ER+/PR+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: My Prayer During Breast Cancer Dixiemine30 JannoD

Posts.Content: Mar 26, 2012 09:09AM Dixiemine30 wrote: I chose BMX and have zero regrets.  I had DCIS, grade 3 on the left side and was a canidate for lumpectomy with radiation.  I chose BMX because I couldn't bear the thought of having to spend the rest of my life testing and worrying about it all the time.  Whatever choice you make will be the right choice for you.  Once you make it, own it and never look back.  Good luck to you.

Posts.Title: Very scared jilllori SusanHG

Posts.Content: Apr 1, 2012 11:56AM Dixiemine30 wrote: HAPPY DANCE!!  NO MORE DRAINS!!  WHOOHOO!!! Nothing more freeing that getting rid of those boogers!!  Whew, I went 3 weeks with mine and was ready to take them out myself.  The first shower after was pure heaven :-) Driving - Be very careful.  I drove after 3 weeks (after drains removed) and then realized I should have waited.  I had a little fluid build up and ended up turning my TE upside down.  Yes, thats right, I fill one from the top and one from the bottom.  After that, I drove with my elbows by my side...and still do most of the time.  I'm 8 weeks out. Fatigue -- It was many, many weeks before I didn't tire out.  All you can do is roll with it and sleep when you need to sleep.  Yep...in the recliner, I was in mine for 28 nights. You are doing FANTASTIC for 2 weeks out!!  Happy healing to you...
Posts.Title: Hooray! Drain tubes out today! icefishinglady mmswarowski
